South Koreans Vow to Struggle against Expansion of U.S. Military Base
articles.content:
South Koreans Vow to Struggle against Expansion of U.S. Military Base 
    Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- Members of the All-People Measure Committee for Checking the Expansion of the U.S. Military Base in Phyongthaek of south Korea reportedly held a meeting to vow to struggle against the expansion of the U.S. military base at the plaza of Phyongthaek railway station on Oct. 29.
 Present there were inhabitants and workers of Phyongthaek and Ansong areas and members of civic and social organizations.
 An appeal read out at the meeting said that the members of the committee, together with inhabitants would enter into an indefinite sit-in strike to check the U.S. forces' moves for expanding their base for a war of aggression to the last and bring peaceful future to the Korean Peninsula.
 It called upon the population in Phyongthaek area to actively join in the strike.    
 At the end of the meeting permanent co-representatives of the committee pitched tents to go on the indefinite sit-in strike.
 The strikers staged a candlelight demonstration that evening.

EU Moves for "Resolution on Human Rights of North" Assailed in S. Korea
articles.content:
EU Moves for "Resolution on Human Rights of North" Assailed in S. Korea
    Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- The Reunification Solidarity in south Korea reportedly issued a statement on Oct. 28 and urged the EU to immediately halt its moves to bring a "resolution on human rights of the north" before the UN General Assembly.
 Referring to the fact that the EU officially announced on Oct. 26 that it would bring the resolution before the UN General Assembly, the statement branded the resolution as a vicious political vituperation document devoid of objectivity, international impartiality and truth, taking advantage of the U.S. "human rights offensive" against the north.    
 It is an intolerable criminal hostile act that the U.S. and its followers are trying to reverse the process of the six-party talks far from striving to denuclearize the Korean Peninsula and building lasting peace mechanism with the talks at hand, it said.

articles.title: Vice-Premier Ro Tu Chol Meets Swedish Ambassador
articles.content:
Vice-Premier Ro Tu Chol Meets Swedish Ambassador
    Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- Ro Tu Chol, vice-premier of the DPRK Cabinet, met and conversed with new Swedish Ambassador to the DPRK Mats Foyer who paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Thursday.

articles.title: Paek Nam Sun Meets Polish Ambassador to DPRK

Paek Nam Sun Meets Polish Ambassador to DPRK
    Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun met and had a talk with new Polish Ambassador to the DPRK Roman Iwaszkiewicz who paid a courtesy call on him today.

articles.title: GNP-Touted "North's Request for Designs of Sub and Aegis" Refuted
articles.content:
GNP-Touted "North's Request for Designs of Sub and Aegis" Refuted
    Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- Ri Pang Ho, National Assemblyman from the Grand National Party, speaking at "National Assembly interpellation" on Oct. 25 told the nonsense that the north side declared its total stop to the work with Hyundai Asan because the Hyundai side turned down the former's request for the transfer of designs for a submarine and Aegis warship."
 A spokesman for the Korea Asia-Pacific Peace Committee answering a question raised by KCNA in this regard on Nov. 2 said:
 Explicitly speaking, what Ri uttered is a whopping lie which does not deserve even a passing note as such a thing can never happen nor has ever taken place. Hyundai Group, too, dismissed the remarks as groundless and preposterous rubbish as they lacked any material evidence, saying that he even failed to distinguish Hyundai Shipbuilding from Hyundai Heavy Industries.    
 The recent case only goes to prove once again that the GNP is a party of political charlatans bereft of elementary conscience and morality as a human being and a group of those keen on anti-reunification acts as they leave no means untried to hamstring cooperation between the fellow countrymen.
 The GNP has long lost the value of its existence as a political entity for its traitorous nature and crimes committed by its members. It should be thrown into the dumping ground of the times because it has no room to stay today when the north and the south are advancing toward reconciliation and cooperation under the banner of the June 15 joint declaration.    
 We can never pardon the GNP which has worked so hard to defame even the dignified system in the north by floating such sheer lie.
 We strongly demand the GNP unconditionally apologize for its crimes, clearly mindful of the consequences to be entailed by its serious mistake.
 An unconditional disbandment of the GNP, cesspool of crime, is prerequisite to putting an end to the confusion inside south Korea, developing the north-south economic cooperation and promoting national reconciliation and unity.
